channel.title: Prepared Guitars on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Prepared Guitars on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Bizarre String Theories
item.description: Today in Tedium: Of the many fascinating experiments on the internet these days involving red hot nickel balls, my personal favorite is this one, involving two guitars. This clip, apparently inspired by nickel-ball innovator Matthew Neuland’s uncle, at first attempted to show whether a fiery nickel ball would put the guitar out of tune. Then Neuland used the nickel ball to destroy the strings. It’s far from the first example of someone messing with guitar strings just to see what might happenâ€”in fact, there’s something of a whole subgenre of guitar playing based on the concept of modifying or breaking guitars in unusual ways.
